# paletteLabel

**Instance Property**

The label that appears when the toolbar item is in the customization palette.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var paletteLabel: String { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you support toolbar customizations, you must provide palette labels for your items. In most cases, you can apply the same value to this property and the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbarItem/label] property. However, you might use this property to offer a more descriptive string, or to provide a label string when the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbarItem/label] property contains an empty string.

## Describing the item

- **possibleLabels**: The set of labels that the item might display.
- **label**: The label that appears for this item in the toolbar.
- **title**: The title of the toolbar item.
- **toolTip**: The tooltip to display when someone hovers over the item in the toolbar.
